means: 限制与控制的强行施加

sentence.Network_en: a clampdown on drinking and driving
Opposition groups see the bannings as the latest stage of a government clampdown.
sentence.Network_cn: 反对派将这些查禁事件视为政府压制的一个新阶段。

sentence.Network_en: If anything, it could create a clampdown on democratic tendencies by regimes in neighbouring countries.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果其主张会产生什么结果的话, 那就是会使周边国家的政府对民主潮流进行压制.

PerfectNetExp.abs: GRE(红宝书) - English 考研论坛 ... clammy adj. 冷湿的，冷粘的 clampdown n. 对言行的限制或禁止 clanger n. 明显的错误.
chase追逐，追赶clampdown压制，取缔clemency仁慈
The municipal government has decided to have a clampdown on building new business centre buildings ., 市政府决定不准再建造新的商业中心大楼.
In April the G 20 declared a clampdown on tax havens ., 四月份的 G20 峰会宣布将取缔逃税天堂.

list.abs: They ought to back the new clampdown ., 他们本应该支持这项新的纳税政策.
the timing of the clampdown is not accidental .打击的时机并非偶然。

the timing of the clampdown appears to be linked to the rising profile of China Development Brief-which recently organised a conference on China's role in Africa and a party attended by several hundred NGO members and friends .取缔简报的时间与简报的壮大有关联，简报近期组织了一场关于
He also announced a clampdown on illegal Roma camps , the expulsion of illegal Roma immigrants ., 他还宣布取缔吉普赛非法聚居地 , 驱逐吉普赛非法移民.

entry.def: A clampdown is a sudden restriction on a particular activity by a government or other authority.

example.ex: ...a clampdown on the employment of illegal immigrants...
example.tran: 对雇用非法移民的打击

example.ex: Ironically, the latest clamp-down has just led to renewed international criticism.
example.tran: 让人哭笑不得的是，最近的制裁结果只是导致新一波国际社会的批评。

auth_sentence.content: But across Europe, a clampdown may not stop there.
auth_sentence.res_content: But across Europe, a clampdown may not stop there.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But across Europe, a clampdown may not stop there.

auth_sentence.content: News outlets are also protesting what they consider as a clampdown on press freedoms.
auth_sentence.res_content: News outlets are also protesting what they consider as a clampdown on press freedoms.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: News outlets are also protesting what they consider as a clampdown on press freedoms.

sentences.en: If anything, it could create a clampdown on democratic tendencies by regimes in neighbouring countries.
sentences.cn: 如果其主张会产生什么结果的话，那就是会使周边国家的政府对民主潮流进行压制。
